TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi List extends System.Windows.Documents.Block

Docs.summary: A block-level flow content element that provides facilities for presenting content in an ordered or unordered list.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> enforces a strong content model for child content. See [TextElement Content Model Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/textelement-content-model-overview.md) for more information about the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> content model.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> is a flow content element designed to be formatted with markers such as bullets or numbering.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem> elements are the only permissible children for a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> element.
## Examples The following example shows how to define a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> using [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_titlexaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-titlexaml-md.md)].
[!code-xaml[ListSnippets#_ListXAML](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ListSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml#_listxaml)]
The following example shows how to create and populate a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> programmatically.
[!code-csharp[ListSnippets#_List_Props](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ListSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#_list_props)] [!code-vb[ListSnippets#_List_Props](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ListSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#_list_props)]
The following figure shows how this example renders.
![Screenshot: Ordered list](~/add/media/ordered-list.png "Screenshot: Ordered list")
The following example shows how to define a nested <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> (lists within lists) using [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_titlexaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-titlexaml-md.md)].
[!code-xaml[ListSnippets#_NestedListXAML](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ListSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml#_nestedlistxaml)]
The following figure shows how this example renders.
![Nested list](~/add/media/flow-nested-list-example.png "Nested list")

This property has no default value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItemCollection> returned by this property to enumerate or manipulate the contents of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> element.
## Examples The following examples show how to perform common operations on a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> using the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List.ListItems%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double MarkerOffset { double get(); void set(double value); };
member this.MarkerOffset : double with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between the contents of each element, and the near edge of the list marker.
Docs.value:
A double value specifying the desired distance between list content and the near edge of list markers, in device independent pixels.
A value of (equivalent to an attribute value of "Auto") causes the marker offset to be determined automatically.
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or - - or - ``` ## XAML Values *double* String representation of a value equal to or greater than **0.0** but smaller than . An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels. Strings need not explicitly include decimal points. *qualifiedDouble* A *double* value as described above, (excepting `Auto`) followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`. `px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)] `in` is inches; 1in==96px `cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px `pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px Auto Causes the marker offset to be determined automatically from the current font characteristics. Equivalent to a property value of . ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the starting index for labeling the items in an ordered list.
Docs.value:
The starting index for labeling items in an ordered list.
The default value is **1**.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has no effect on unordered lists. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |
